header.title: The Flaming Star of Set
header.category: Western Esotericism, Draconian Magic, Left Hand Path

central_thesis: The ritual system aims to invoke the Draconian Current of Set, systematically awaken and activate the five psychic senses within the practitioner's 'Dragon body,' and ultimately unify these activated senses with a 'sixth sense' to achieve full Set-consciousness and self-deification.

structure_content.summary: This section outlines the ritual's context, emphasizing its origin as part of the Open Project in October 2014. It details the preparation of the temple space, including the placement and symbolic coloring of the Sigil of the Eye of Set and a large pentagram. It specifies the arrangement of five red candles at the pentagram's points and one black candle (representing the Flame of Set) at its center. Instructions are given for single-ritual or seven-day performance, with emphasis on anointing the sigil/forehead and focusing on the sigil's activation.

This initial invocation begins with a formal address to 'the Dragon, Primal Source of All Creation' and 'Lord of the Inner Flame, The Red One, The Furious One,' inviting Set to merge with the practitioner. It includes a specific incantation ('Shta-t shep ari khet') and a serpent-like mantra ('SA-TA AT-NE-SA'). The meditation involves gazing at the sigil, visualizing its fiery transformation into a gateway to the Nightside, and experiencing Set's fiery breath, culminating in the practitioner envisioning themselves within the burning Pentagram.

This ritual focuses on awakening Clairvoyance, the first psychic sense, represented by the first flame of the pentagram (upper left point). It involves lighting the first red candle, focusing on self within the Flaming Star, and speaking an invocation to 'Mighty Sutuach' to grant 'Dragon's Eyes.' The meditation includes visualizing fiery snakes emerging from the sigil, entering the eyes, shutting off physical sight, and perceiving the world through heightened inner vision, seeing through barriers and illusions.

This part activates Clairaudience, the psychic equivalent of physical hearing. The practitioner lights the second red candle and invokes 'Mighty Sutuach, Voice of the Thunder,' calling to hear the 'Void whisper.' The meditation guides the fiery snakes into the ears, temporarily overwhelming physical hearing before opening 'Dragon's Ears' to perceive extrasensory sounds, voices of spirits, and vibrations from other dimensions, allowing remote hearing and interaction with non-physical beings.

Dedicated to Clairscent, the psychic sense of smell, this ritual involves lighting the third red candle and invoking 'Mighty Sutuach, He Before Whom the Sky Shakes,' to fill the practitioner with 'predatory senses' and 'enhance my smell.' The meditation visualizes fiery snakes entering the nose, shutting off physical smell, and opening the inner sense to perceive fragrances and odors from other realms, places, and beings across the universe, akin to the sharp senses of a beast.

This ritual awakens Clairgustance, the psychic sense of taste. The fourth red candle is lit, and 'Great Sutuach, Strongest of the Gods,' is invoked to 'taste my blood' and fill the practitioner with gnosis. The meditation guides fiery snakes into the mouth, opening it to become 'Dragon's jaws.' The focus is on perceiving the essence of spiritual and ethereal substances, combining this new sense with previously activated psychic abilities to experience the world through Set's sharp, multi-dimensional taste.

The final individual psychic sense, Clairtangency (clear touching/psychometry), is activated here. The fifth red candle is lit, and 'Mighty Sutuach, The Furious One,' is invoked to 'give me your touch.' The meditation involves fiery snakes entering the palms, spreading Set's Draconian Current throughout the body, setting it ablaze. This combines all awakened 'Dragon's senses' with touch, making visual experiences tangible and translating subtle energy impulses into physical impressions, experiencing the world through Set's unconstrained senses.

This is the culminating ritual, uniting all five awakened Dragon senses with a 'sixth sense' (body-wide 'feeling') to achieve full Set-consciousness. All five red candles are lit, and a comprehensive invocation to Set (using titles like 'Lord of the Red Desert,' 'Voice of Thunder,' 'Self-Created God,' and phrases like 'Xeper-i-Set') is spoken. The meditation involves the Pentagram's fire enveloping the practitioner, entering all senses, and the practitioner ultimately becoming the Flaming Star itselfâ€”a state of unique, powerful Set-consciousness, with guidance to explore this merged being.

This section provides essential esoteric and magical context for the ritual. It defines Set as the God of Storm and Change, representing dynamic transformation and self-creation on the Left Hand Path. It explains the symbolism of the Flaming Star (inverted pentagram) in occult traditions, relating its five points to the 'Dragon body's' psychic senses and the 'sixth flame' (Black Flame) to isolated consciousness and self-deification. Key terms like Sh/Shin (Fire Snake Kundalini) and ShT (name of Set) are explained, along with the sigil of the Eye of Set as a manifestation of the Eye of the Dragon and a gateway to the Current of Set.

key_concepts.definition: The God of Storm and Change, the principle of dynamic transformation, triumph over chaos, and a self-created being. He embodies lust, fury, passion, and the Divine Fire, representing the inner spark of Godhood and the fiery pillar of Ascent on the Left Hand Path.
The powerful energetic flow or force associated with Set, which is invoked and integrated into the practitioner to facilitate spiritual ascent, psychic awakening, and self-transformation.

A form of the inverted pentagram, symbolizing 'evil,' the Left Hand Path, the Adversary, and the reversal of natural order. Its five points represent the five psychic senses within the 'Dragon' body of the practitioner, while the entirety of the activated star symbolizes the practitioner's unified Set-consciousness.

A sigil representing the Eye of the Dragon and awakened consciousness. It is formed by 'SATA' (the Serpent of the Underworld) and functions as a living gateway to the Current of Set, focusing the initiatory process towards the 'Within'.

Five extrasensory perceptions developed through the ritual, corresponding to the physical senses: Clairvoyance (sight), Clairaudience (hearing), Clairscent (smell), Clairgustance (taste), and Clairtangency (touch/psychometry). These are activated in the 'Dragon body' to perceive beyond mundane limitations.

Referred to as the 'sixth flame,' this is the symbol of isolated consciousness on the path of self-deification within the Setian tradition, arising from the awakening and integration of the five psychic senses.
A powerful magical phrase used in invocations, meaning 'I have come into being by Set' or 'I become Set,' signifying self-creation and identification with the deity.
An epithet or name for Set, frequently used in the ritual's invocations to address and evoke the deity.
An invocation phrase used at the beginning of the general invocation of Set, intended to 'open the gates to the Current of Set' and facilitate His presence.
A mantra, chanted slowly in a low, whispering voice like a snake's hiss, used to focus on the sigil and activate its energies during the initial invocation of Set.

practical_system.description: The 'Flaming Star of Set' is a progressive, initiatory magical system designed to invoke the Draconian Current of Set. It systematically guides the practitioner through rituals to awaken and integrate five psychic senses (conceptualized as 'Dragon senses'), culminating in a state of 'Set-consciousness' and the practitioner's self-realization as the 'Flaming Star.' The methodology relies heavily on focused visualization, mantra chanting, specific invocations, and deep meditative absorption into the essence and energies of Set.
tools: Sigil of the Eye of Set (printed or self-drawn)
Large Pentagram (drawing, cloth, or wood, for altar)
Five Red Candles (for the points of the pentagram)
One Black Candle (for the center of the pentagram, representing the Flame of Set)
Blood (optional, for anointing sigil and/or forehead)
rituals: General Temple Preparation and Sigil/Pentagram Setup
Initial Invocation of Set (with mantra SA-TA AT-NE-SA)
Ritual of the Flaming Star (Culminating invocation for Set-consciousness)

relevant_quotes.text: In the name of the Dragon, Primal Source of All Creation, I open the gates to the Current of Set, Here in this temple and within the depths of my soul, And I invoke the Lord of the Inner Flame, The Red One, The Furious One, To enter my being and become as one with me, As I become as one with him. Shta-t shep ari khet.

The power of the Second Flame is Clairaudience. It corresponds to the physical sense of hearing and is based on the perception of sound. In the Dragon body this refers to perceiving sounds and extrasensory vibrations with the "inner ears."

The power of the Fifth Flame is Clairtangency, known also as "clear touching" or psychometry. This form of extrasensory perception corresponds to the physical sense of touch. In magical work this ability makes the visual experience tangible, as subtle impulses and vibrations of energy are "translated" through the sense of "touch" into physical impressions, which creates a bridge between a psychic manifestation and a physical experience.

I am the lord of storms and the bringer of Fire, I spread my Dragon wings and I emerge from the Womb of Darkness, Forming myself by my Will alone! I am the blade that cuts through the stifling web of stagnation and inertia, I am the lust and fury that shall not be constrained, I am the untamed force that shakes foundations of the universe, And I am the Flame that turns man into God! I am Set! I an the Self-Created God!

The sigil used in the project represents the Eye of Set, which is a manifestation of the Eye of the Dragon, the symbol of awakened consciousness. The Eye is formed by SATA, the Serpent of the Underworld, in his double aspect, representing the cycle of death and birth in rites of passage that are a part of the initiatory process.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant to contemporary Left Hand Path and Draconian magic, particularly for practitioners interested in Setianism and self-deification. It offers a structured, progressive approach to psychic development, framing it within a specific esoteric cosmology of Set and the Draconian Current. The emphasis on activating and integrating the five psychic senses as 'Dragon senses' and culminating in Set-consciousness provides a unique, yet recognizable, path of initiation, drawing on themes of transformation and overcoming mundane limitations. Its focus on inner experience and visualization makes it adaptable, though deeply personal, within operative occult practice.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists of experienced occult practitioners, specifically those engaged in Left Hand Path traditions, Draconian magic, Setianism, or individuals seeking structured methods for advanced psychic development within an esoteric framework. It assumes familiarity with magical concepts, ritual practice, and a deep commitment to intensive meditative work and self-transformation. It is not suitable for beginners due to its complex concepts, powerful invocations, and emphasis on direct communion with potent entities.
